> Since you downloaded the Javadoc, could you shed some light on the
> goal of the Request class?

Follow the link in David's post.

I can generally highly recommend the practice of getting more accurate
information before jumping to conclusions.

> Also, I'm not quite sure I understand why I need to create a Request
> first whenever I need a filter...

From a number of such conversations, I have the feeling that you and the
authors of Junit have very different design strategies.

Junit seems to be designed to only provide basic functionality, plus
injection points in the design to extend Junit in all kinds of ways, mostly
using what I'd call "classic GoF style" OO design.

You seem to be more inclined to designs that feel more "monolithic" to me,
but provide flexibility by being "programmable" as an alternative, by ways
of XML, scripting etc. (Which is not necessarily bad, although I have to
admit that I prefer the Junit style.)

If that's the case, it doesn't surprise me that much of the design of Junit
doesn't seem to make sense to you.

Cheers, Ilja
